author.bio:
I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

You can still see my posts on archive.org. And check out +uslashremoved!

I'm cqtz- on reddit and cqtz on SaidIt. https://youtube.com/watch?v=o_LskiXQ73c

body:
I'm not sure why posts from users with private profiles are hidden from search results in the first place, but at least they should be able to see their own posts.

(I'm not talking about general search engines. I'm talking about the Ruqqus search feature.)

(Reposted because of a wording issue)
body_html:
I'm not sure why posts from users with private profiles are hidden from search results in the first place, but at least they should be able to see their own posts.

(I'm not talking about general search engines. I'm talking about the Ruqqus search feature.)

(Reposted because of a wording issue)

guild.description:
This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here. 

+ruqqusbugs

title: If you have private mode enabled, you should be able to see your own posts in search results

author.bio:
Ruqqus is a [fraud](https://ruqqus.com/+TheoryOfRuqqus/post/66bf/theory-of-sneed)

![](https://files.catbox.moe/p6c06p.png)

still lots to do to establish FoS discussion platforms, and certainly Ruqqus won't be part of it
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus is a fraud

body:
maybe searching your own posts should be a separate feature, but that's probably best served by having your own content downloaded, which is supposed to be in the pipeline

private profiles are hidden from search results because that could completely render the feature useless (it's a bit of an anti-feature, but hey)
body_html:
maybe searching your own posts should be a separate feature, but that's probably best served by having your own content downloaded, which is supposed to be in the pipeline

private profiles are hidden from search results because that could completely render the feature useless (it's a bit of an anti-feature, but hey)
